result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric D Hines was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Court does not object to transfer to Milwaukee County if accepted

miscConds.notes:
*Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
*Undergo grief counseling
*Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
*If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
*Costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation

records.addlTxt:
1:40 PM Defendant Eric D Hines in court.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court for Eric D Hines.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court finds the state has complied with victim's rights. 
Case called for arraignment and Defense requests plea and sentencing. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of Information and waives reading.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 

State places offer on the record. 
Court conducts plea colloquy.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 2-4.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
Count 1 is Dismissed and read in.
State and Defense make sentencing recommendations. 
Victim A makes statement to the court.
Defendant makes statement to the court. 

Court orders the following:

COUNT 2: 
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  1 YEAR; Court does not object to transfer to Milwaukee County if accepted; 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
*Undergo grief counseling; 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done;

CONDITION TIME: 20 DAYS, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

RESTITUTION:  $0;
COSTS:  $243
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation. Any residual owed once probation has concluded may be converted to a civil judgment. 
*******************************************
COUNT 3: 
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  1 YEAR; Court does not object to transfer to Milwaukee County if accepted; 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Same as Count 2; 

COSTS:  $243
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation. Any residual owed once probation has concluded may be converted to a civil judgment. 
***************************************
COUNT 4: 
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  1 YEAR; Court does not object to transfer to Milwaukee County if accepted; 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Same as Count 2; 

COSTS:  $243
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation. Any residual owed once probation has concluded may be converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

1:20 PM Defendant Eric D Hines in court.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court for Eric D Hines. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim A appeared in person.

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
The State does not have an information at this time.
The Court will adjourn the matter to the trial court for an arraignment.

1:15 PM Defendant Eric D Hines in court.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court for Eric D Hines. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim A appeared in person.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.
Arraignment scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on August 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:00 AM Defendant Eric D Hines in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes Attorney Ritter previously filed a request for an adjournment but due to Marsey's Law the Court did not remove today's date off the calendar.  Victim A is in Court and does not object to an adjournment.  The Court will adjourn the initial appearance.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Request to adjourn court date
  **Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 08-04-2022. "The court will not adjourn the initial appearance."

Filed by Atty Ritter, requests an adjournment, due to a sentencing in milwaukee co. Sent to CC Herring for review. Court's response 8/2: Due to Marsy's law and Victim notification, the court will hold the hearing.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
